required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Cold Sore Treatments on Ultra Violet (UV) Induced Cold Sores
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cold Sore Treatments on UV Induced Cold Sores

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if a new drug treatment is effective to block the development of a cold sore lesion following Ultra Violet (UV) exposure.

detailed_description.textblock:
This was a multi-center, randomized, evaluator and subject-blind, placebo controlled study design
The objective of this study was to evaluate the ability of the test articles to block the development of a cold sore lesion from progressing beyond the prodromal stage following a UV-induced process.
The primary efficacy endpoint of this study was to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms was aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle) via assessing lesion stages by a trained evaluator.
The secondary efficacy endpoints included: a) subject self-assessments and b) test article weights and diaries to track treatment compliance.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by a Trained Evaluator
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the trained evaluator. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered "aborted" or "blocked". Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by the Participant
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the participant. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered "aborted" or "blocked". Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.

intervention.description: Sublingual micro dosing of placebo for 7 days
Sublingual micro dosing of BTL-TML-HSV for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical history of recurrent cold sores averaging 2 or more episodes per year
- UV exposure is known to cause a cold sore outbreak
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of abnormal reactions to sunlight
- Used antiviral therapy directly prior to entering study
- Any other condition which in the opinion of the Investigator may affect the results or place the subject at undue risk.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment occurred from 29Jul2013 through 09Sep2014. Subjects were recruited through three research clinics located in the US who had been trained in UVr application used to trigger recurrent oral Herpes Simplex Labialis.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects who did not meet inclusion/exclusion or withdrew consent prior to enrollment were not enrolled in the study. Eligible subjects underwent minimum erythema dose (MED) UVr determination and if MED criteria was met were randomized. Those enrolled who did not develop prodrome following the UVr induced process were not treated.

group.title: Matching Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo Treatment regimens will be as follows (upon the first signs/symptoms of prodrome (tingling, itching, burning): Day 0 – Take 1 drop every 10 minutes for the 1st hour following appearance of prodrome symptoms (0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 and 60 minutes), then 1 drop every hour until bedtime. Days 1 & 2 – Take 1 drop six times daily – Days 3-7 – Take one drop twice daily

group.title: BTL-TML-HSV
group.description: Experimental Product BTL-TML-HSV: Sublingual micro dosing of BTL-TML-HSV for 7 days Treatment regimens will be as follows (upon the first signs/symptoms of prodrome (tingling, itching, burning): Day 0 – Take 1 drop every 10 minutes for the 1st hour following appearance of prodrome symptoms (0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 and 60 minutes), then 1 drop every hour until bedtime. Days 1 & 2 – Take 1 drop six times daily – Days 3-7 – Take one drop twice daily

participants_list.participants: Number of randomized participants who developed a cold sore and used the assigned treatment.
Number of randomized participants who developed a cold sore and used the assigned treatment.
21 not treated - did not use placebo medication as they did not develop cold sore
19 not treated /did not use medication as they did not develop a cold sore

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not develop a cold sore

baseline.population: Demographics based on number of subjects who were randomization and subsequently assigned investigational product

group.title: Matching Placebo
group.description: Placebo Safety Population - All subjects enrolled and received placebo test article

group.title: BTL-TML-HSV Active Treatment
group.description: BTL-TML Safety Population - All subjects enrolled and received active test article

outcome.title: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by a Trained Evaluator
outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the trained evaluator. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered “aborted” or “blocked”. Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.
outcome.population: Participants that did not experience prodrome stage as assessed by the evaluator or met major protocol violations were not included in the PP analysis.

group.title: Matching Placebo
group.description: Placebo Efficacy Population - All subjects enrolled and received placebo test article and met Per protocol definition

group.title: BTL-TML-HSV Active Treatment
group.description: BTL-TML Efficacy Population - All subjects enrolled and received active test article and met Per Protocol definition

measure.title: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by a Trained Evaluator
measure.description: The primary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the trained evaluator. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered “aborted” or “blocked”. Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.
measure.population: Participants that did not experience prodrome stage as assessed by the evaluator or met major protocol violations were not included in the PP analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by the Participant
outcome.description: The secondary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the participant. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered “aborted” or “blocked”. Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.
outcome.population: 158 subjects randomized to treatment. 118 subjects used allocated assigned treatment (62 test article and 56 placebo). 7 subjects failed to complete and 111 completed study. For this secondary analysis (self assessments) 53 subjects noted prodrome occurring on Day 0.

group.title: Matching Placebo
group.description: Placebo efficacy Population - All subjects who received placebo test article and were compliant with protocol

group.title: BTL-TML-HSV Active Treatment
group.description: BTL-TML Efficacy Population - All subjects who received active test article and were compliant with protocol

measure.title: Number of Participants for Whom a Recurrent Oral Herpes Episode Initiated With Prodromal Symptoms Were Aborted Before Progressing to a Lesion as Assessed by the Participant
measure.description: The secondary efficacy endpoint of this study is to determine if a recurrent oral herpes episode initiated with prodromal symptoms is aborted before progressing to a lesion (vesicle stage) via assessing lesion stages by the participant. Any episode of oral herpes that did not reach a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 (based on evaluator and self-assessments of legion stage) was considered “aborted” or “blocked”. Any episode of oral herpes that reached a vesicle stage or higher by Day 7 was considered a treatment failure.
measure.population: 158 subjects randomized to treatment. 118 subjects used allocated assigned treatment (62 test article and 56 placebo). 7 subjects failed to complete and 111 completed study. For this secondary analysis (self assessments) 53 subjects noted prodrome occurring on Day 0.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected from the time of informed consent until end of follow up period which was up to 14 days after start of treatment.
reported_events.desc: Serious AE were collected for all patients. AEs noted over 5% were only for those patients that took study medication.

group.title: Matching Placebo
group.description: Placebo Safety Population - All subjects that enrolled and were allocated to placebo test article except for SAEs and that includes all subjects that signed informed consent.

group.title: BTL-TML-HSV Active Treatment
group.description: BTL-TML Safety Population - All subjects enrolled and allocated to active test article except for SAEs which includes all subjects that signed informed consent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
